Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2014 01:32AM mkahle wrote: Hi ladies! I hope you're still following this thread  I see it's been awhile since anyone posted. It's been awhile since I've been on these boards or else I would have joined in earlier  I've been on Halaven since early June and had great results with markers after the first cycle but since then they've started slowly creeping up. I had scans last week and am waiting on those results. I see that many said you do 2 weeks on and one week off. Anyone do 3 weeks on and 1 off? Starting the wonder why my onc put me on 3 weeks. Didn't realize when we started that 3 wasn't the norm.
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: mkahle wrote: Hi ladies! I've never posted before and even took a hiatus for several months but am desperately seeking some answers.  I started Tamoxifen January 7, 2014 and found out a few days ago that my tumor markers have tripled. My liver counts are still normal or close to normal though. I also finished 10 days of external radiation on January 7th to my pelvic bones and femurs. Wondering if anyone else experienced what I'm praying are tumor flares. If so, how much did your markers increase and how soon did they start going back down? Dx 3/28/2013, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 4/15/2013 AC + T (Taxol) Radiation Therapy 12/22/2013 Bone Hormonal Therapy 1/6/2014 Chemotherapy 3/9/2014 Xeloda (capecitabine) Chemotherapy 6/1/2014 Halaven (eribulin) Surgery 10/12/2014 Prophylactic ovary removal Chemotherapy 10/23/2014 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tumor Markers and Tamoxifen mkahle blainejennifer
